diagnosis.final_diagnosis: hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia with spinal macro-AVF
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT) was supported by the patient's family history of HHT and characteristic cutaneous telangiectasia. Imaging, including spinal MR and subsequent angiography, revealed a large macro-arteriovenous fistula (MA VF) in the thoracic spinal canal causing venous varix and surrounding spinal cord edema, indicating a high risk for neurological deficits.
